overview:
This class allows you interact with Cloud Speech API.

First, install @google-cloud/speech with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/speech

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/speechâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var speech = require('@google-cloud/speech')();

Elsewhere

var speech = require('@google-cloud/speech')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/speech are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: SpeechClient
methods.description: Service that implements Google Cloud Speech API.

methods.name: getProjectId
methods.description: Get the project ID used by this class.

params.name: callback
params.description: • the callback to be called with the current project Id.

methods.name: recognize
methods.description: Performs synchronous speech recognition: receive results after all audio has been sent and processed.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.config
params.description:
Required Provides information to the recognizer that specifies how to process the request.

This object should have the same structure as RecognitionConfig

params.name: request.audio
params.description:
Required The audio data to be recognized.

This object should have the same structure as RecognitionAudio

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing RecognizeResponse.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing RecognizeResponse. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: longRunningRecognize
methods.description: Performs asynchronous speech recognition: receive results via the google.longrunning.Operations interface. Returns either an Operation.error or an Operation.response which contains a LongRunningRecognizeResponse message.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.config
params.description:
Required Provides information to the recognizer that specifies how to process the request.

This object should have the same structure as RecognitionConfig

params.name: request.audio
params.description:
Required The audio data to be recognized.

This object should have the same structure as RecognitionAudio

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is a gax.Operation object.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is a gax.Operation object. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: streamingRecognize
methods.description: Performs bidirectional streaming speech recognition: receive results while sending audio. This method is only available via the gRPC API (not REST).

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: opts.servicePath
params.description: The domain name of the API remote host.

params.name: opts.port
params.description: The port on which to connect to the remote host.

params.name: opts.sslCreds
params.description: A ClientCredentials for use with an SSL-enabled channel.

params.name: opts.clientConfig
params.description: The customized config to build the call settings. See {@link gax.constructSettings} for the format.
